Title: 💬 @PoliticsGR Commentary: 🇱🇧🇮🇱 At this point, we see the sam...
Description: 💬 @PoliticsGR Commentary:🇱🇧🇮🇱 At this point, we see the same story unfolding every day:🔸 Hezbollah bombs Israeli northern settlements, including military sites.🔸 Israel strikes southern Lebanon and tries to kill a senior Hezbollah commanders in Beirut.🔸 Hezbollah bombs Israel again, targeting mainly military bases.🔸 Israel has material damages, Lebanon suffers many casualties.🔸 Repeat and roles may change on who bombs first during the day.A valid question raised by many is about how whether Hezbollah can maintain its role in Lebanon as -a state within a state-. For now, Hezbollah has much support in the south (among Shi’ites and some Christians) due to its role in the 1985-2000 and 2006 wars, which was largely victorious and defended Beirut from Israeli aggression. It didn’t disarm after the conflicts, exerted pressure on the Lebanese political system in order to solidify its presence, gained experience at the Syrian battlefield and continued stacking missiles for ages. However as the casualties in Lebanon increase and more high ranking officials are murdered, it is bound for the organisation to conduct similar operations against Israeli officers, thus inflicting heavy blows on Tel Aviv. This solution becomes more urgent as Israel is conducting advanced operations against its members using the leverage of its espionage network and its technology edge, as we saw with the interruption of communication methods and precision strikes.Whether it is actually feasible to see direct strikes on the Israeli leadership, it is to be answered in the next months. In a global geopolitical environment without limits and with the past’s fear of a nuclear apocalypse sidelined, many actors rely on escalation to achieve their goals.
